This website is AudioEye enabled and is being optimized for accessibility. To open the AudioEye Toolbar, press "shift + =". Some assistive technologies may require the use of a passthrough function before this keystroke. For more information, activate the button labeled ‚ÄúExplore your accessibility options‚Äù.

49th Street Closure

In April, a culvert that conveys water from the Evans Ditch under 49th Street in the vicinity of 35th Avenue suffered a catastrophic failure forcing a road closure. Due to irrigation needs and utility constraints, repairs are scheduled for early fall after the irrigation season. 49th Street in this area will remain closed until repair work is completed. Thank you for your patience.

Close alert

# Mayor - Mark Clark

Menu

![](https://www.evanscolorado.gov/media/u3ahgapn/mark_clark_mayor.jpg?rxy=0.49424720806245076%2C0.33690575106780357&width=400&height=400&v=1db2bb97a83e550&format=webp)

Mark Clark

Mayor

Term Expiration: November, 2026

Voicemail: (970) 475-2220

[mclark@evanscolorado.gov](mailto:mclark@evanscolorado.gov)¬†

Mark, and his wife Maria along with their two sons have lived in Evans for over 14 years. He is an Active Guard Reservist in the Wyoming Air National Guard with over 16 years of military service and a graduate of Colorado State University. He has deployed to the Middle East and has supported the U.S Forest Service deploying several times throughout the United States to support MAFFS (Modular Airborne Fire Fighting System) Operations.¬†

His vision for the City is broad; he promotes providing our police department with an adequate facility, promoting growth and development, a diverse economy, road and infrastructure improvements, ensuring residents of Evans have access to adequate services, and ensuring the City lives within its means without sacrificing customer service. ¬†

Mark currently serves on the Strike Team, The Northern Front Range Metropolitan Planning Organization (NFRMPO), and the Highway 85 Collation. ¬†

In his free time he enjoys traveling and flying his Piper Cherokee.

[Your Government](https://www.evanscolorado.gov/your-government)
